text.tspan: Please note: Additional charges may apply in the future when adding additional information.
Following the selection of a single existing recipient from the Select Recipient page, the user is able to input details for the
requested payment. The Basic and Account Information about the recipient is auto-populated and not editable.
Clicking on the ‘Add’ text link here, the user is able to add additional information. This will take the user to the first
page of the Remittance Information flow for the user to manually enter the additional information (see
DBank_RemittanceInformation_DD file for more details). Adding additional information is completely optional.
In this case no additional information is add, so no documents are listed in this section.
The alert banner here reminds users that adding additional information is not a required step when making a
payment. If they choose to add additional information about this payment, additional charges will apply.
The ‘Save’ CTA saves a draft of the payment allowing the user to complete this flow at another time. Draft payments
can be found and accessed on the Payments Landing page under ‘Draft Payments’ section.
The user is able to click on the recipient name text link here to view read only recipient details. This will open as
another level overlay, with clicking on the X icon to close the read only recipient details overlay as the only action
The user must complete all the required fields here before moving on to the next step of reviewing their payment.
The optional fields are marked accordingly. By default, these fields are empty on this page.
The comment text field has a maximum character count of 120 to ensure the Activity Log comment field remains
succinct. The character counter here is dynamic to the text entered in this field: formatted as: character used /
Clicking on the back icon will take the user back to the previous step in the flow, which in this case is Select
Clicking ‘Cancel’ CTA will prompt a cancel dialog confirming the user’s action to cancel this flow, effectively
discarding any unsaved information. Once confirmed, the user is brought back to the Payments Landing page or
Recipient Details page where they started with no changes made.
Clicking on the ‘Review’ CTA will take user to the next step of the Payment Creation flow to the Review Payment
page. The user must enter all required fields before being able to move to the next step.
The ‘ + Add Another Payment’ text link allows multiple payments to be made to the same recipient. Selecting this text
link adds another payment card to this recipient. There is a limit of 10 payments per recipient at one time.
may apply in the future when
5.0 - Payment Creation flow - Enter Payment - Single Recipient
Web Business Banking Modernization - Employee UI
